required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhanced Function and Quality of Life Following 5 Months of Exercise Therapy for Patients With Rotator Cuff Tears
clinical_study.official_title: Enhanced Function and Quality of Life Following 5 Months of Exercise Therapy for Patients With Irreparable Rotator Cuff Tears - an Intervention Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of 5 months of exercise therapy for patients with irreparable rotator cuff tears.

detailed_description.textblock: All included patients will receive exercise therapy consisting of two exercises focusing on strengthening m. deltoideus anterior and m. teres minor.

primary_outcome.description: Change is measured from baseline to 3 and 5 months

secondary_outcome.description: Change is measured from baseline to 5 months
Range of motion measured in flexion, abduction and external rotation using a goniometer. Change is measured from baseline to 5 months
Strength was measured in flexion, abduction, internal and external rotation using af dynamometer. Change is measured from baseline to 5 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic flexion in degrees from 0 to 180
secondary_outcome.description: Change is measured from baseline to 5 months
Muscle activity was measured using surface electromyography of m. trapezius superior and m. deltoideus anterior Change is measured from baseline to5 months
Furthermore, patients were asked to evaluate their pain on a Visual Analogue Scale while performing flexion

intervention.description: 5 months of exercise therapy with two strengthening exercises focusing on m. deltoideus anterior and m. teres minor. Furthermore, a warm up exercise was applied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- symptoms of rotator cuff rupture for at least three months with rupture of minimum musculus supraspinatus and musculus infraspinatus visualized by ultrasonography or arthroscopy
- no neurological conditions which could affect muscle strength or activity
- able to read and understand Danish
- both patients with and without a history of shoulder trauma were included
Exclusion Criteria:
- former rotator cuff surgery
- history of shoulder fracture or inflammatory conditions in the shoulder
- significant osteoarthritic changes on antero-posterior and/or lateral (outlet view) radiographs

overall_official.affiliation: Northern Orthopaedic Division, Aalborg University Hospital

facility.name: Northern Orthopaedic Division, Aalborg University Hospital
